member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.PropertyGrid.CancelPropertyValueEditHandlers
member.summary: Gets a mapping between control types and associated delegates to be performed when an Escape key down event is received by a .
member.value: A mapping between control types and associated delegates.
member.remarks: When a KeyDown event is raised on a , the PropertyGrid will use the control with focus to find an associated delegate in the CancelPropertyValueEditHandlers dictionary. If a matching entry is found, it will be executed. Exact type matches will be used first, then each base type will be queried.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.PropertyGrid.CanClearDataObjectOnUnload
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the property is cleared when the property grid is unloaded.
member.value: true if the property is cleared when the property grid is unloaded; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Clearing the property when the property grid is no longer needed is important to prevent memory leaks from property change notification handlers. The property can be cleared manually or the CanClearDataObjectOnUnload property can be set to true to automatically do this when the control is unloaded.

The CanClearDataObjectOnUnload property should not be set to true if a property grid or its ancestor hierarchy can get temporarily unloaded. For instance, when a property grid is in a tab control, the property grid is unloaded when the parent tab is deselected. Likewise, when a property grid is a docking window, the property grid is temporarily unloaded during dock operations as layout changes occur. In these sorts of scenarios, it is better to manually clear the property when the primary UI (such as a main window) is closed.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeExpansionKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of expand or collapse.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeExpansionKind.Single
member.summary: A single item is affected.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeExpansionKind.Branch
member.summary: A branch of items are recursively affected.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeExpansionKind.All
member.summary: All items are recursively affected.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemChildrenQueryMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode by which a tree item's children are queried.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemChildrenQueryMode.OnDisplay
member.summary: Query the item's children when all of the item's ancestors are expanded. The item is only expandable if there is at least one child item.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemChildrenQueryMode.OnExpansion
member.summary: The item is only expandable by default. When the item is expanded, query the item's children, and disable expandability if there are no child items.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemDropArea
member.summary: Specifies a drop area when a drag is over a target item.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemDropArea.None
member.summary: The drag is not over a target item.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemDropArea.Before
member.summary: The drag is over the top portion of the target item, hinting to to insert before the target item.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemDropArea.On
member.summary: The drag is directly over the target item, hinting to insert into the target item.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemDropArea.After
member.summary: The drag is over the bottom portion of the target item, hinting to to insert after the target item.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemExpandability
member.summary: Specifies a tree item's support for expansion toggling.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemExpandability.Auto
member.summary: Logic is used to determine whether the item supports expansion toggling.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeItemExpandability.Never
member.summary: The item doesn't support expansion toggling.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeListBox.FocusItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Focuses the container for the specified node, scrolling it into view as needed.
member.param: The node whose container should be focused.
member.remarks: This method can be a bottleneck in very large trees where the specified node hasn't yet been exposed to the control by its ancestor nodes all being expanded. In that scenario, a full tree search is required to locate the node. For that case, it is recommended to use the method that searches by full path instead, since that can be much faster.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeListBox.IndentIncrement

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeListBox.IsDataVirtualizationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data virtualization is enabled.
member.value: true if data virtualization is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
Only set this property to true when using virtualized collections that implement . In most scenarios, this data virtualization feature is not needed since UI virtualization is always active in the control.
When the data virtualization feature is enabled, as a query for child items is made, an will be created for each child item. The only property initially touched on the virtualized collection is Count. Then when an item's UI container is first requested, the will be used to call into the virtualized collection's indexer and retrieve the real item. This allows for virtualized data retrieval of paged sections as needed, instead of the entire collection at once.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeListBoxItemAdapter.CanHaveChildren(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.TreeListBox,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified item is capable of having child items.
member.param: The owner control.
The item to examine.
member.returns: true if the specified item is capable of having child items; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
The default implementation of this method returns true. This method should only return false if an item is not capable of having child items and is always a 'leaf' node in the tree. It should not return false if the item can have child items, but doesn't at the current time.
Optimizations are in place to not call when this method returns true. This method should be overridden if is used and certain items are known to be 'leaf' nodes.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Grids.Primitives.TreeNodeItemCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.Grids.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.
